instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
this came in with various side liquid damaged, i have replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>, but still no ppdcin, even though there's no short..
using fake charger no green light too..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Do you get <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> with fake charger, or lab PSU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: with fake charger, i get 12.6 at <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: wait , it become 0.8v with fake charger at <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Lab PSU, or fake charger should always deliver =<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_S5_CHGR</SIGNAL>.
Did you mean <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, instead of <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R6995</RESISTOR> is bad, replaced, now I have pp16v5 at ppdcin, pp3v42 3.42v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> 3.4v
<SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> is 3.4v up to pin 5 of charging port
 sometimes i have green light, and then i replug the port, and its gone, and <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> is back at 1.6v,..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Try another DCIN board.
Do you get stable <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
when I have full ppdcin, ppbus is at 12.26v, yes i did suspect smc, i will give it a light reflow
dcin board is known good

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Incorrect <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage.
Check first <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.
If good, check voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
but most of time, I either have 0v or low ppdcin..
does <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> cause low ppdcin ? there's no short on <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> but i cannot measure thevoltage because i dont even have ppdcin

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: i actually have a 30 ohm short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>, but i intend not to bother with it until I have stable green light

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: yeah this board is massacred by another technician before..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Thonk if worth to waste time on it then.
Do you get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> alwaysif power it with lab PSU, or fake charger?
If yes, this denotes an input leakage issue.
